content:
• Thursday, October 18, 2012
  • SNY

    Genzyme, a Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) company, and Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) announce that the FDA...

    Genzyme, a Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) company, and Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) announce that the FDA has voted 9 to 6 to support the marketing of Kynamro, or mipomersen sodium, for the treatment of patients with Homozygous Familial Hypercholesterolemia. Isis +15% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • RHI

    More on Robert Half (NYSE:RHI): Q3 meets on the top line and beats on the bottom as net profit...

    More on Robert Half (NYSE:RHI): Q3 meets on the top line and beats on the bottom as net profit rose 31% Y/Y on better revenue and margins across all segments. Service revenue grew 4.9% to $1.03B. Gross margin widened to 40.2% from 39.8%. Shares +2,2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD: The company is: 1) Planning to cut 15% of its workforce as part of its...

    More on AMD: The company is: 1) Planning to cut 15% of its workforce as part of its restructuring, which it says will be "largely completed" in Q4. AMD expects to achieve $190M in 2013 cost savings, and record $80M in Q4 restructuring charges. Past rumors indicated job cuts of anywhere from 10%-30%. 2) Guiding for Q4 revenue of $1.1B-$1.21B, below a $1.33B consensus. CPU division sales fell 11% Q/Q and 28% Y/Y in Q3, while GPU division sales fell 7% Q/Q and 15% Y/Y - both are clearly losing share. AMD nearly unchanged AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 12 Comments
  • MRVL

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) -10% AH after: 1) Warning it expects FQ3 (Oct. quarter) revenue of...

    Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) -10% AH after: 1) Warning it expects FQ3 (Oct. quarter) revenue of $765M-$785M, below a consensus of $813.4M. The chipmaker blames weak hard drive controller sales caused by soft PC demand. 2) Announcing CFO Clyde Hosein has resigned to "pursue other opportunities." Corporate controller Brad Feller will serve as interim CFO until a replacement is found. Rival LSI-OLD could trade lower in sympathy. Hard drive forecasts have been quickly going downhill.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) +9.2% AH after guiding on its Q3 earnings call (webcast) for Q4 revenue...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) +9.2% AH after guiding on its Q3 earnings call (webcast) for Q4 revenue of $230M-$236M and EPS of $0.29 vs. a consensus of $232.6M and $0.28. Unlike with Google, it looks as if the analysts who made bullish calls in recent weeks (I, II) were on the mark.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) +2.7% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its big Q3 beat. Surging volumes...

    SanDisk (SNDK) +2.7% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its big Q3 beat. Surging volumes (no doubt related to strong smartphone/tablet demand) allowed gross margin to rise 270 bps Q/Q to 31%, though it fell 1330 bps Y/Y. SanDisk claims it "gained share across all major geographies" (no specifics about which products). Guidance should be provided during the earnings call, which starts at 5PM ET (webcast). Rival Micron (NASDAQ:MU) is up slightly. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • COF

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): The impact of the HSBC credit card business makes comparisons...

    More on Capital One (NYSE:COF): The impact of the HSBC credit card business makes comparisons (at least for the core credit card business) difficult. Net interest margin of 6.97% vs. 6.04% last quarter, 7.4% a year ago. Net charge-off rate (excluding acquired loans) of 2.18% vs. 1.96% last quarter, 2.62% a year ago. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • CYN

    City National (NYSE:CYN): Q3 EPS of $1.10 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $317.2M (+18% Y/Y) beats by...

    City National (NYSE:CYN): Q3 EPS of $1.10 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $317.2M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $36M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG), down 10.4% AH, are now off 37% from where they traded just three...

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG), down 10.4% AH, are now off 37% from where they traded just three months ago as the momentum finally wears thin for the stock. Whether Einhorned or not, the restaurant chain's comparable restaurant guidance for 2013 - set at flat to low-single digit growth - doesn't square away to traders with CMG's lofty earnings multiples.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 8 Comments
  • BLDR

    Builders FirstSource (NASDAQ:BLDR): Q3 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $291.8M (+34.3%...

    Builders FirstSource (NASDAQ:BLDR): Q3 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $291.8M (+34.3% Y/Y) beats by $17M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • RMBS

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q3 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.31. Revenue of $57.7M beats by $1.7M. Shares...

    Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS): Q3 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.31. Revenue of $57.7M beats by $1.7M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • CMG

    More on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Growth at the chain clearly slows with comparable restaurant sales...

    More on Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Growth at the chain clearly slows with comparable restaurant sales only up 4.8% after a double-digit pace has been the norm the last few years. Restaurant level operating margin rose 70 bp to 27.4%. The company expects to open 165-180 new restaurants in 2013 and forecasts flat to low-single digit comparable restaurant sales for the year. Shares -11.1% AH. Conference call scheduled for 4:30 EST (webcast) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $218.6M (+15% Y/Y)...

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q3 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $218.6M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CMG

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Q3 EPS of $2.27 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $700.5M (+18.4% Y/Y) misses by...

    Chipotle (NYSE:CMG): Q3 EPS of $2.27 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $700.5M (+18.4% Y/Y) misses by $1.7M. Shares -8.1% AH (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q3 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $70.9M (flat%...

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC): Q3 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $70.9M (flat% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA +3.2%), North America's no. 2 natural gas producer after Exxon Mobil, continues to...

    Encana (ECA +3.2%), North America's no. 2 natural gas producer after Exxon Mobil, continues to rise in the wake of yesterday's news that XOM is bolstering its Canadian shale gas portfolio with its purchase of Celtic Exploration. Shares are up 6.5% since the announcement. Also, Cormark says ECA is undertaking a process to identify potential partners for its liquids-rich plays.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -4.5%) is heading into the close with decent losses after Barclays launches...

    Fusion-io (FIO -4.5%) is heading into the close with decent losses after Barclays launches coverage with an Equal Weight and $32 target. Shares fell earlier this week after Jim Cramer advised against buying. FQ1 results arrive on Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) gains after submitting a proposal to the Department of Health and...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) gains after submitting a proposal to the Department of Health and Human Services for funding of the remaining steps needed for government approval of Entolimod as a medical radiation countermeasure. The proposal is based on FDA feedback regarding the pivotal programs and animal-to-human dose conversion, and is intended to address points of concern noted by BARDA in connection with its previous Entolimod proposal.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -4.5%) gives back much of yesterday's gains after CEO Frederic de...

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -4.5%) gives back much of yesterday's gains after CEO Frederic de Narp denies reports the company is looking to sell its watch and jewelry business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) has resumed trading after releasing an official Q3 report that largely...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) has resumed trading after releasing an official Q3 report that largely matches its draft report. Shares are down 7.5%, a little above the levels they were at when shares were halted. Citi's Mark Mahaney, who was singing Google's praises last month, calls the report "negatral," and isn't happy with Motorola's performance. Piper notes revenue derived from Google-owned sites was up just 2.5% Q/Q after rising 8% the last two years. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 10 Comments
  • SNA

    Snap-On (SNA +3.7%) gains after its Q3 report beat estimates on all counts this morning. Net...

    Snap-On (SNA +3.7%) gains after its Q3 report beat estimates on all counts this morning. Net earnings rose 9.3% as the company reported stronger sales, led by 10% Y/Y growth in its tools group and higher-margin segments such as power generation and aerospace. Gross margin rose to 47.8% from 47.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • ERIC

    Though Nokia is lower following its Q3 report, Ericsson (ERIC +2.1%) and Alcatel-Lucent (ALU...

    Though Nokia is lower following its Q3 report, Ericsson (ERIC +2.1%) and Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +4.2%) appear to be rallying because of it, thanks to the relatively positive results posted for rival Nokia Siemens. Not only did the long-struggling telecom equipment firm see a €409M Q/Q operating profit swing (aided by restructuring efforts), its revenue rose 3% Y/Y, a nice reversal from Q2's 8% drop. A 29% increase in Asia-Pac sales was responsible for the growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • DO

    Recent deals struck by Diamond Offshore (DO +1.8%) and Noble (NE +4.3%) paint a picture of a...

    Recent deals struck by Diamond Offshore (DO +1.8%) and Noble (NE +4.3%) paint a picture of a market in which deepwater oil rigs will be in high demand for years, while other drilling segments may end up being too well supplied. DO predicts as many as 40 deepwater rigs in the Gulf of Mexico next year, vs. 31 now; both firms expect ultra-deepwater rates to keep heading higher. (earnings: DO, NE)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM

  • Prospect Global Resources (PGRX +4.9%) trades higher after the company reported that a study...

    Prospect Global Resources (PGRX +4.9%) trades higher after the company reported that a study confirms it's Holbrook Basin project, a potash field in eastern Arizona, will be competitive. According to the report, key capital expense elements are in line with 2012 expectations. The company adds that the positive aspects of the report indicate that its bankable feasibility study, which is due in 2013, will likely increase its resources and optimize its mine plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT -1.9%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with a $48 price target by RBC after its...

    Potash (POT -1.9%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with a $48 price target by RBC after its profit warning yesterday, citing challenging potash fundamentals. RBC thinks 2013 will be a challenging year for POT, given its "outlook for softening potash prices and the risk that the company may need to reduce production."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • KEY

    KeyCorp (KEY +4.6%) soars following its earnings report. Unlike many other banks, Key recorded a...

    KeyCorp (KEY +4.6%) soars following its earnings report. Unlike many other banks, Key recorded a big 17 basis point jump in net interest margin to 3.23% thanks to some fancy liability management (see conference call exchange with Mike Mayo). Total loans +2.5% Q/Q, +5.6% Y/Y. Tier 1 common equity of 11.43% vs. 11.28% a year ago. Book value/share of $10.64 vs. $10.09 a year ago. (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • AKS

    The WTO rules the U.S. did not illegally dump a type of specialty steel into the Chinese market...

    The WTO rules the U.S. did not illegally dump a type of specialty steel into the Chinese market beginning in 2010. The dispute involved duties imposed by China on "grain-oriented electrical steel" used in the cores of high-efficiency transformers, electric motors and generators and made by AK Steel (AKS +0.1%) and Allegheny Technologies (ATI +1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • BEL

    Orient-Express Hotels (OEH +22.4%) jumps after India's Tata Group offered $1.86B in an all cash...

    Orient-Express Hotels (OEH +22.4%) jumps after India's Tata Group offered $1.86B in an all cash bid for the hotelier last night. Tata is seeking to expand its international luxury-hotel chain that includes The Pierre in New York, and OEH owns New York's 21 Club restaurant and the Hotel Cipriani in Venice, Italy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +4.3%) keeps driving higher, now trading within a dime of their...

    Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +4.3%) keeps driving higher, now trading within a dime of their all-time highs. The company continues to draw rave reviews for its ability to latch on early to properties that translate into box office successes. (LGF box office totals 2012)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • CYBI

    Premium exercise equipment manufacturer Cybex International (CYBI +81%) surges after receiving a...

    Premium exercise equipment manufacturer Cybex International (CYBI +81%) surges after receiving a buyout offer from UM Holdings, its largest individual shareholder, to purchase all remaining shares it currently doesn't own for $2.55 each.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • LLTC

    Two days after posting its FQ1 report, Linear Technology (LLTC -2.1%) is underperforming thanks...

    Two days after posting its FQ1 report, Linear Technology (LLTC -2.1%) is underperforming thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from Nomura. The firm isn't happy with Linear's guidance for a 5%-10% Q/Q revenue drop, and thinks shares are expensive at 18x estimated 2013 EPS. The firm considers rival Maxim (MXIM -0.9%), which has strong exposure to Samsung and a lower valuation, a better play. FBR argued for Maxim over Linear in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • ETH

    Shares of Ethan Allen (ETH +20.9%) roar higher on heavy volume after the furniture maker beats...

    Shares of Ethan Allen (ETH +20.9%) roar higher on heavy volume after the furniture maker beats the estimate of analysts comfortably with its FQ1 report. The word from traders is that the squeeze play is on.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • IMUC

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC -13.8%) slides after pricing its secondary offering of...

    ImmunoCellular Therapeutics (OTCPK:IMUC -13.8%) slides after pricing its secondary offering of 10M shares at $2.10, a 13% discount to yesterday's close. The company also is offering warrants to purchase as many as 4.5M additional shares. It plans to use the proceeds for the ongoing clinical development of its brain cancer treatment and lead pipeline product, ICT-107, as well as for general corporate purposes. The company had 40.6 million shares outstanding as of August.
     

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • GOOG

    Google (GOOG -9%) says printing firm R.R. Donnelley (RRD -2.8%) filed a draft of its weak Q3...

    Google (GOOG -9%) says printing firm R.R. Donnelley (RRD -2.8%) filed a draft of its weak Q3 report without authorization. Google adds it will deliver a finalized report, after which shares will resume trading. Meanwhile, Horace Dediu observes Motorola's phone sales fell 26% Y/Y, and Cory Johnson notes Google's cost per click (search ad price) trend isn't a pretty sight. One-liners are flying on Twitter (I, II, III) over the report, and a "pending" Larry Page quote. Update: Google says it expects to resume trading before the market's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 16 Comments
  • ALGN

    Align Technology (ALGN -24.8%) gets slammed after its Q3 missed estimates across the board. Net...

    Align Technology (ALGN -24.8%) gets slammed after its Q3 missed estimates across the board. Net profit actually rose 26% Y/Y as the maker of Invisalign braces reported higher shipments, but the company gave a weak Q4 outlook and says it's conducting a review for a possible goodwill write-down. It now expects to earn between $0.21 to $0.23 per share on revenue of $134.2M to $137.8M. Analysts are looking for $0.31 on $148M in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRGP

    Targa Resources (TRGP -1.9%) expects FY 2012 adjusted EBITDA at or slightly below low-end...

    Targa Resources (TRGP -1.9%) expects FY 2012 adjusted EBITDA at or slightly below low-end guidance of $515M, including the impact from Hurricane Isaac and lower average liquefied natural gas prices, which are ~25% lower than the company assumed when it issued guidance at this time last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • FB

    Several Internet stocks are heading south in response to Google's early Q3 report. Facebook (FB...

    Several Internet stocks are heading south in response to Google's early Q3 report. Facebook (FB -2.8%), Yelp (YELP -2.7%), Groupon (GRPN -2.8%), Zynga (ZNGA -1.6%), and LinkedIn (LNKD -2.1%) are among the casualties.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • CYBI

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYBI +81%. OEH +26%. BWEN +23%. IESC +20%. ETH +20%. GIVN +18%. AEGR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: CYBI +81%. OEH +26%. BWEN +23%. IESC +20%. ETH +20%. GIVN +18%. AEGR +17%. VIMC +16%. WCC +14%. CHCI +13.
    Top 10 Losers: ALGN -24%. MNKD -23%. MLNX -21%. CYTR -19%. GORO -16%. OTCPK:IMUC -14%. RCON -13%. LXRX -11%. BCOM -11%. UFPI -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GOOG

    Google's (GOOG -8.4%) Q3 results are out early, and they missed estimates. EPS of $9.03 missed...

    Google's (GOOG -8.4%) Q3 results are out early, and they missed estimates. EPS of $9.03 missed by $1.62, and revenue of $11.33B (+51% Y/Y, boosted by Motorola acquisition) missed by $530M. Shares are diving.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 63 Comments
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +4.3%) gives back the majority of its early gains as analysts prove skeptical that...

    Juniper (JNPR +4.3%) gives back the majority of its early gains as analysts prove skeptical that EMC would consider buying the company, as is suggested by a rumor. Cantor, UBS, Goldman, and Oppenheimer all consider an EMC-Juniper unlikely, though Oppenehimer thinks Ericsson or a P-E firm could be interested. Also, a source tells Reuters Juniper hasn't hired an i-bank to facilitate a purchase, contradicting the rumor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • PRGS

    Progress Software (PRGS +6.1%) pops after announcing a deal to sell 4 product lines to private...

    Progress Software (PRGS +6.1%) pops after announcing a deal to sell 4 product lines to private software firm Trilogy Enterprises for $114M. Progress says the product lines have generated $83M in sales this year, and that their divestment will leave only two more lines to be sold as part of the company's efforts to rid itself of "non-core" offerings. (CEO resignation/guidance withdrawal)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • UFPI

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI -11.5%) takes a hit after a disappointing Q3 report late...

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI -11.5%) takes a hit after a disappointing Q3 report late yesterday. Net profit fell 25% as the wood-products and construction materials company suffered higher input costs, plus a $2M one-time charge related to Canadian taxes on certain products imported from China.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • NOK

    Up premarket following its Q3 report, Nokia (NOK -3.2%) has turned negative. Ongoing cash burn...

    Up premarket following its Q3 report, Nokia (NOK -3.2%) has turned negative. Ongoing cash burn and a 38% Q/Q drop in smartphone shipments to 6.3M seem to be overshadowing a revenue beat (fueled by strong Asha phone sales) and slight operating profit. Also, Nokia's total mobile phone ASP fell 10% Q/Q and 16% Y/Y to EUR43, thanks to a mix shift from smartphones (EUR155 ASP) to feature phones (EUR31 ASP). European volumes rose 10% Q/Q, but Chinese volumes fell 27%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • NOG

    Northern Oil & Gas (NOG -5.1%) expects Q3 production to increase ~96% Y/Y and ~9% Q/Q,...

    Northern Oil & Gas (NOG -5.1%) expects Q3 production to increase ~96% Y/Y and ~9% Q/Q, resulting in an average of ~11,200 boe/day. During the first two months of the quarter, the weighted average days on production was 55 out of a possible 62 producing days, or ~89% of potential producing days.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 6 Comments
  • NVAX

    Novavax (NVAX +3.5%) gains after saying that Phase I clinical studies of it's investigational...

    Novavax (NVAX +3.5%) gains after saying that Phase I clinical studies of it's investigational avian influenza vaccine met their primary objectives of safety and immune response.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • MNKD

    MannKind (MNKD -23.7%) takes a hit after pricing its MNKD -23.7%) takes a hit after pricing 40M...

    MannKind (MNKD -23.7%) takes a hit after pricing its MNKD -23.7%) takes a hit after pricing 40M shares of stock and warrants for another aggregate 30M. Each share of common is being sold together with a warrant for 0.75 shares of common at $2.00. The drug developer is looking to raise funds for general corporate purposes. The company had 199.4 million shares outstanding as of August.">secondary offering of 40M shares of stock and warrants for another aggregate 30M. Each share of common is being sold together with a warrant for 0.75 shares of common at $2.00. The drug developer is looking to raise funds for general corporate purposes. The company had 199.4 million shares outstanding as of August.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • PVG

    Pretium Resources (PVG -1.8%) says drill results from its Brucejack project in British Columbia...

    Pretium Resources (PVG -1.8%) says drill results from its Brucejack project in British Columbia continue to confirm the projection and continuity of high-grade gold, including additional intervals grading more than one kilogram/metric ton of gold.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • PM

    Tobacco stocks slump after the Q3 report from Philip Morris (PM -2.9%) comes in sluggish....

    Tobacco stocks slump after the Q3 report from Philip Morris (PM -2.9%) comes in sluggish. Despite higher prices, the industry is having trouble keeping demand up as governments start to enact stricter packaging and marketing rules across the globe. Decliners: British American (BTI -0.7%) -0.7%, Lorillard (LO -0.3%) -0.5%, Reynolds American (RAI -0.6%) -0.7%, Altria (MO -1%) -1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • SVU

    Highlights from Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) earnings call: 1) The company says it was forced to get...

    Highlights from Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) earnings call: 1) The company says it was forced to get more promotional in Q2 due to weak demand and low traffic. 2) Wayne Sales promises his team will continue to target areas for cost savings. 3) Cash flow guidance reduced to $950M after factoring in capital spending increases, debt payments, and asset sales. 4) Save-A-Lot is still viewed as salvageable after getting "off-strategy" under prior leadership. 5) Nothing concrete on who's sniffing around as a potential buyer is unveiled. Shares +8.9% on heavy volume. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) roundup: 1) Bloomberg reports Amazon is in talks to buy Brazilian...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) roundup: 1) Bloomberg reports Amazon is in talks to buy Brazilian bookseller Saraiva. Saraiva, which currently has a market cap of $356M, is both a publisher and retailer of books (online and via physical stores). The report appears to be pressuring MercadoLibre (MELI -3.5%), which has already fallen on worries Amazon will enter Brazil. 2) The WSJ observes Amazon is struggling to make its publishing efforts a success in the face of boycotts from many booksellers. (earlier: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • CYTR

    Oncology specialist CytRx Corp. (CYTR -18.7%) slides after pricing an 8M share secondary...

    Oncology specialist CytRx Corp. (CYTR -18.7%) slides after pricing an 8M share secondary offering at $2.50, a 20% discount to yesterday's close. Gross proceeds were around $20M. The company, which had 21.2 million shares outstanding as of August, plans to use the funds for the development of its drug candidates, as well as for other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    A123 (AONE +27.1%) shares roar higher after Wanxiang President Ni Pin says his company is still...

    A123 (AONE +27.1%) shares roar higher after Wanxiang President Ni Pin says his company is still interested in taking over A123 despite the company filing for Chapter 11 this week and calling off its investment deal with the Chinese autoparts firm. Ni tells Bloomberg that the filing may make A123 more attractive. "Bankruptcy court is like a filter that lets a dirty big boy covered with mud go through it and turn himself into a clean boy," Ni says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 12 Comments
  • LXRX

    Lexicon (LXRX -10.8% to $2.23) sinks sharply after pricing an offering of 17.5M shares at $2.25...

    Lexicon (LXRX -10.8% to $2.23) sinks sharply after pricing an offering of 17.5M shares at $2.25 each, a 10% discount to yesterday's close. The net proceeds will be $37.2M, which the biotech plans to use for R&D. The underwriters have an option to purchase another 2.625M shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • OCZ

    After rebounding a bit yesterday, OCZ (OCZ -8.1%) is continuing its descent today after...

    After rebounding a bit yesterday, OCZ (OCZ -8.1%) is continuing its descent today after disclosing its sales chief has left. Also, OCZ says it has received a Nasdaq non-compliance letter thanks to its delayed FQ2 10-Q filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (LRCX +5.4%) pops following its FQ4 report. While results beat estimates, FQ1...

    Lam Research (LRCX +5.4%) pops following its FQ4 report. While results beat estimates, FQ1 guidance for revenue of $820M-$880M and EPS of $0.38-$0.52 is largely below a consensus of $927M and $0.49. But the Street has already priced in a very dour near-term outlook for chip equipment demand. During its earnings call, Lam said it has lowered its 2012 forecast for global chip equipment spending to $28B-$29B - that's below the $31.4B (-13% Y/Y) recently forecast by Gartner.
